channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Negative prices for electricity are getting more common in Europe and consumer costs have dipped—while Americans face rising energy bills
item.description: By September, the number of hours in Spain with negative prices had already topped 500 for the year to date, more than double the full-year total for ...

item.title: Copper records biggest annual gain since 2009 on supply bets
item.description: The red metal has notched a series of all-time highs in an end-of-year surge, rallying 42% on the London Metal Exchange this year.

item.title: Dollar set for worst year since 2017 with Fed drama center stage
item.description: “The biggest factor for the dollar in first quarter will be the Fed,” said Yusuke Miyairi, a foreign-exchange strategist at Nomura.

item.title: Gold and silver stumble at the end of best year since the 1970s
item.description: “In my career, it’s unprecedented,” said John Reade, a market veteran and chief strategist at the World Gold Council.

item.title: Canadian stocks set record for records in ‘jaw-dropping’ year
item.description: “The numbers themselves are somewhat jaw dropping,” said IG Wealth Management chief investment strategist Philip Petursson by phone.
